title: Destroy

properties.name: description
properties.value: Destroy is a feature in Old School RuneScape for certain quest-related items, discontinued items and holiday drops that replaces the usual "Drop" option available to all other items. It most often applies to items which cannot be traded.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Destroy (action)

Destroy is a feature in Old School RuneScape for certain quest-related items, discontinued items and holiday drops that replaces the usual "Drop" option available to all other items. It most often applies to items which cannot be traded.

These items cannot be dropped, but may be picked up if a player has a full inventory upon receiving one. While in the inventory, they can only be destroyed. This option was most probably introduced by Jagex to prevent players from using the drop trick for certain items. Before being destroyed, a text is shown as a final warning to players. The warning also instructs players on how to reclaim these items unless the item cannot be reclaimed when destroyed. The only tradeable items with a destroy option are impling jars with an impling trapped inside, Binding necklaces, and Hunter kits.

The destroy option was introduced with the Garden of Tranquillity quest.

Most modern holiday items, such as the Chicken feet, can be destroyed and retrieved from Diango in Draynor Village.

Destroying an object.
rawContent:
{{External|rs=Destroy (action)}}
'''Destroy''' is a feature in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'' for certain [[quest]]-related items, discontinued items and holiday drops that replaces the usual "Drop" option available to all other items. It most often applies to items which cannot be traded.

These items cannot be dropped, but may be picked up if a player has a full inventory upon receiving one. While in the inventory, they can only be destroyed. This option was most probably introduced by [[Jagex]] to prevent players from using the [[drop trick]] for certain items. Before being destroyed, a text is shown as a final warning to players. The warning also instructs players on how to reclaim these items unless the item cannot be reclaimed when destroyed. The only tradeable items with a destroy option are [[impling jar]]s with an impling trapped inside, [[Binding necklace]]s, and [[Hunter kit]]s.

The destroy option was introduced with the [[Garden of Tranquillity]] quest.

Most modern holiday items, such as the [[Chicken feet]], can be destroyed and retrieved from [[Diango]] in [[Draynor Village]].

[[File:Destroy.png|centre|frame|Destroying an object.]]
